Lestarikan Nilai Budaya Bangsa, Senior Harus Jadi Contoh bagi Generasi Muda
06 Nov 2019, 21:51 by Miechell Octovy Koagouw


Lestarikan Nilai Budaya Bangsa, Senior Harus Jadi Contoh bagi Generasi Muda

KBRN, Jakarta : Nilai-nilai adat dan budaya tak boleh ditinggalkan dalam menjalankan setiap sendi kehidupan berbangsa dan bernegara di Indonesia. Sejalan dengan itu, Pendekatan kebudayaan harus digunakan guna menghadirkan Haluan Negara melalui amandemen terbatas Undang Undang Dasar 1945 (UUD 1945) sesuai usulan MPR RI.Majelis Adat Kerajaan Nusantara (MAKN) yang diwakili Ketua Dewan Kerajaan MAKN PYM Ida Tjokorda Ngurah Jambe Pemecutan (Raja Denpasar IX Puri Agung Denpasar), Ketua Harian MAKN YM KPH Eddy Wirabumi (Kasunanan Surakarta Hadiningrat Solo), Sekjen MAKN YM Yani WSS Kuswodidjoyo (Pengageng Sumenep), serta Bidang Advokasi MAKN YM Herman (Palembang Darusalam), coba meneguhkan bagaimana nilai-nilai adat dan budaya itu tidak ditinggalkan apabila memang amandemen terbatas UUD 1945 dilakukan.Hal tersebut sudah dipertanyakan MAKN kepada Ketua MPR RI Bambang Soesatyo saat kunjungan ke Gedung MPR RI, Ruang Rapat Pimpinan MPR, Kompleks Parlemen Senayan Jakarta, Selasa (5/11/2019) kemarin.Ketua MPR RI yang karib disapa Bamsoet tersebut juga sudah memastikan, bahwa keberadaan Pasal 32 UUD Negara Republik Indonesia (NRI) 1945 yang menjamin kehadiran negara dalam memajukan kebudayaan nasional di tengah peradaban dunia, serta penghormatan dan memelihara bahasa daerah sebagai kekayaan budaya nasional, tidak akan diganggu gugat. "Menghilangkan nilai-nilai sakral budaya bangsa dalam amandemen terbatas adalah kemunduran dan tidak akan dilakukan MPR. Saya sudah pastikan itu," sebut Bamsoet melalui pernyataan resmi yang diterima RRI, Rabu (6/11/2019).Dirinya lanjut menuturkan, amandemen terbatas UUD NRI 1945 tidak akan mengubah pasal-pasal terkait adat dan budaya. Terlebih saat ini generasi muda banyak yang kurang memahami nilai-nilai budaya bangsa. Dan itu menurutnya bukan kesalahan generasi muda saja, melainkan para senior juga."Tantangan terbesar yang harus dijawab saat ini adalah, banyak generasi muda yang gagap terhadap budaya nasional. Dan itu bukan kesalahan mereka pribadi. Melainkan ada andil kesalahan para senior yang tidak bisa mewariskan nilai-nilai agung budaya tersebut kepada mereka sebagai generasi muda," jelas Bamsoet.Oleh karena itu, Ketua MPR RI mengajak Majelis Adat Kerajaan Nusantara bersama-sama dengan MPR RI sebagai Rumah Kebangsaan untuk tak kenal lelah menyebarkan sekaligus menanamkan nilai kebudayaan kepada para generasi bangsa. Menjadi teladan bagi generasi muda adalah pilihan tepat saat ini. Demikian diucapkan Bamsoet yang didampingi Wakil Ketua MPR RI Ahmad Basarah.Tantangannya tidak ringan, kata Bamsoet, terlebih bagi MPR RI dan MAKN, dimana keduanya adalah penjaga dan pelestari nilai-nilai kearifan dan kebudayaan lokal. "Apalagi saat ini derasnya informasi teknologi dan dahsyatnya media sosial, turut mempermudah masuknya budaya asing ke dalam diri generasi muda Indonesia. Sikap dan tindak tanduk para senior akan menjadi rujukan para generasi bangsa. Jika ingin generasi bangsa kental dengan nilai-nilai budaya, harus dimulai dari diri sendiri (untuk menjadi contoh)," tandasnya. (Jorike Fitri/Pro3 RRI)

Preserving Nation's Cultural Values, Seniors Must Be an Example for Young Generation
Nov 6, 2019, 21:51 by Miechell Octovy Koagouw


Preserving Nation's Cultural Values, Seniors Must Be an Example for Young Generation

KBRN, Jakarta: Customary and cultural values must not be left behind in carrying out every aspect of the life of the nation and state in Indonesia. Correspondingly, a cultural approach must be used to bring the State Policy through limited amendments to the 1945 Constitution in accordance with the proposal of the Republic of Indonesia MPR. The Indigenous Archipelago Council (MAKN) represented by the Chairman of the MAKN PYM Kingdom Council Ida Tjokorda Ngurah Jambe Pemecutan (Raja Denpasar Denpasar) IX Puri Agung Denpasar), YM KPN MAKN Daily Chairman Eddy Wirabumi (Surakarta Hadiningrat Sunanate Solo), YM Yani YS WSN Secretary General Kuswodidjoyo (Sumenep Pengageng), and YM Herman's MAKN Advocacy Section (Palembang Darusalam), tried to establish how customary values and the culture is not left behind if a limited amendment to the 1945 Constitution is carried out. This has already been questioned by the Chairman of the MPR RI Bambang Soesatyo during a visit to the RI MPR Building, MPR Leadership Meeting Room, Parliament Complex Senayan Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019) yesterday. The Chairperson of the Indonesian People's Consultative Assembly, known as Bamsoet, also confirmed that the existence of Article 32 of the 1945 Republic of Indonesia State Constitution guaranteeing the presence of the state in promoting national culture in the midst of world civilization, as well as respecting and preserving regional languages as national cultural wealth, will not be contested. "Eliminating the sacred values of the nation's culture in a limited amendment is a setback and will not be done by the MPR. I have confirmed that," said Bamsoet through an official statement received by RRI on Wednesday (6/11/2019). He further said, limited amendments to the Constitution NRI 1945 will not change the articles related to customs and culture. Especially at this time many young people do not understand the national cultural values. And that according to him is not just the fault of the younger generation, but also the seniors. "The biggest challenge that must be answered at this time is, many young people are stuttering about national culture. And it is not their own fault. But there is a share of the mistakes of the seniors who cannot pass down "the great values of culture to them as a young generation," explained Bamsoet. Therefore, the Chairperson of the Indonesian People's Consultative Assembly invited the Indigenous Archipelago Council of the Archipelago together with the Indonesian People's Consultative Assembly as the National House to relentlessly spread and instill cultural values to the nation's generation . Being an example for the younger generation is the right choice now. This was stated by Bamsoet who was accompanied by Deputy Speaker of the Indonesian People's Consultative Assembly, Ahmad Basarah. The challenges were not light, said Bamsoet, especially for the MPR RI and MAKN, both of whom were the guardians and preserver of the values of wisdom and local culture. "Especially at this time of rapid technological information and the enormity of social media, helping facilitate the entry of foreign cultures into the younger generation of Indonesia. The attitudes and actions of the seniors will be a reference for the nation's generation. If you want the nation's generation to be thick with cultural values, it must begin from yourself (to be an example), "he said. (Jorike Fitri / Pro3 RRI)
